title: Robustness of Deep Neural Networks for Micro-Doppler Radar Classification
abstract: arXiv:2402.13651v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: With the great capabilities of deep classifiers for radar data processing come the risks of learning dataset-specific features that do not generalize well. In this work, the robustness of two deep convolutional architectures, trained and tested on the same data, is evaluated. When standard training practice is followed, both classifiers exhibit sensitivity to subtle temporal shifts of the input representation, an augmentation that carries minimal semantic content. Furthermore, the models are extremely susceptible to adversarial examples. Both small temporal shifts and adversarial examples are a result of a model overfitting on features that do not generalize well. As a remedy, it is shown that training on adversarial examples and temporally augmented samples can reduce this effect and lead to models that generalise better. translated_title: 深度神经网络在微多普勒雷达分类中的鲁棒性
translated_abstract: 随着深度分类器在雷达数据处理方面的巨大能力，学习特定于数据集的特征而无法很好泛化的风险也随之而来。在这项工作中，评估了两种深度卷积架构在相同数据上训练和测试时的鲁棒性。当遵循标准训练实践时，两个分类器都展现出对输入表示的微小时间偏移的敏感性，这种增强带有最小的语义内容。此外，模型极易受到对抗样本的影响。小的时间偏移和对抗样本都是模型过拟合于无法很好泛化的特征的结果。为了解决这个问题，表明在对抗样本和时间增强样本上进行训练可以减少这种影响，进而导致更好泛化的模型。最后，演示了操作在节奏-速度图表示而不是多普勒-时间的模型。
tldr: 评估了两种深度卷积架构的鲁棒性，发现在训练中加入对抗样本和时间增强样本可以改善模型的泛化能力
en_tdlr: The robustness of two deep convolutional architectures was evaluated, and it was found that training on adversarial examples and temporally augmented samples can improve the model's generalization capability.
